nodes.bodyText:
Rename test databases to prevent name collisions

-> Rename test tables ...

Doh, good point - - It was the tables that were renamed.
I just rebased this PR on tip master, since there were conflicts and removed the commit that renamed the tables.  If the Hive test failures recur, I'll submit a separate PR with the renames.
Keep this private. See comment on the usage below.
These properties are for the Hive writer. Remove this and inline the code below to directly create the column names and types. We don't need to go to/from Hive properties.

This is not needed, as it's for the Hive writer.
jobConf is now only needed for the hdfsEnvironment.getFileSystem() call.

Also not needed. Replace below with
CompressionCodecName compressionCodecName = getCompressionCodec(session).getParquetCompressionCodec()
And probably just inline that into the new IcebergParquetFileWriter() call
This should be IcebergSessionProperties (we can static import the methods). Looks like the properties were added, but not the static methods, so we'll need to add those there.

+                .setMaxPageSize(HiveSessionProperties.getParquetWriterPageSize(session))

nodes.bodyText:
Now that we have a writer for both formats, we could move the code from IcebergPageSink.getMetrics() here and make getMetrics() return just Metrics (non-optional).
Later, we'll replace it with code to return statistics directly from the writer, rather than reading them again from the written file.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -226,4 +277,34 @@ private IcebergFileWriter createOrcWriter(
             throw new PrestoException(ICEBERG_WRITER_OPEN_ERROR, "Error creating ORC file", e);
         }
     }
+
+    public static class IcebergParquetFileWriter
+            extends ParquetFileWriter implements IcebergFileWriter
+    {
+        public IcebergParquetFileWriter(
+                OutputStream outputStream,
+                Callable<Void> rollbackAction,
+                List<Type> fileColumnTypes,
+                MessageType messageType,
+                Map<List<String>, Type> primitiveTypes,
+                ParquetWriterOptions parquetWriterOptions,
+                int[] fileInputColumnIndexes,
+                CompressionCodecName compressionCodecName)
+        {
+            super(outputStream,
+                    rollbackAction,
+                    fileColumnTypes,
+                    messageType,
+                    primitiveTypes,
+                    parquetWriterOptions,
+                    fileInputColumnIndexes,
+                    compressionCodecName);
+        }
+
+        @Override
+        public Optional<Metrics> getMetrics()
+        {
+            return Optional.empty();

nodes.bodyText: Let's make this a top level class to mirror IcebergOrcFileWriter
We shouldn't need both inputColumnNames and fileColumnNames as these should be identical.

We can replace this with
IntStream.range(0, fileColumnNames.size()).toArray()
Same as ORC writer
Use Types.optional() instead of primitive() everywhere
Move above so it's next to the other integer types
Move these to be after integer types

No need for format here since it's just a concat to the end
throw new PrestoException(NOT_SUPPORTED, "Unsupported primitive type: " + type);
Should these be as(intType(..., true)) with 8/16/32?
char and varchar should have stringType() logical type
Changed, and a very nice cleanup!
Maybe use getPrecision() <= 18 here since that matches the Iceberg spec. We aren't using ShortDecimalType here, so at this point the fact that isShort() == 18 is somewhat of a coincidence.

We like to write empty methods like
private IcebergParquetPrimitiveTypeConverter() {}
This and the other comment on HiveParquetPrimitiveTypeConverter were superseded by using the Hive intrinsic schema converter.
OriginalType is deprecated, switch to LogicalTypeAnnotation
Put named() on next line for these
Like Iceberg, based on my reading of org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.io.parquet.convert.HiveSchemaConverter, the char and varchar types should use as(stringType())
Same as Iceberg, these and bigint should have as(intType(..., true))

Add a comment
// this should match org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.io.parquet.convert.HiveSchemaConverter
Good to know about that exception to the opening brace newline convention!
throw new PrestoException(NOT_SUPPORTED, "Unsupported primitive type: " + type);
It's better if presto-parquet doesn't have Hive specific logic. Remove this constructor variant, then you can move HiveParquetPrimitiveTypeConverter to the presto-hive module.
Changed, and it's nice to see the class melt away!
These two lines are not needed

The TIMESTAMP constant uses the default precision 3, milliseconds. You probably want to check the precision of the timestamp type. https://github.com/prestosql/presto/blob/master/presto-spi/src/main/java/io/prestosql/spi/type/TimestampType.java#L66

This morning @electrum and I decided that introducing the PrimitiveTypeConverter was the wrong approach.  We realized all we really needed to create a ParquetFileWriter was Map<List<String>, Type> of the names of primitive type columns and their Presto types, and the MessageType created by ParquetSchemaUtil.convert().
So the code above no longer exists, but thanks for the pointer.
We can remove the columns argument from the method since it's no longer used.
Removed, along with a couple of places in IcebergPageSink on the way here.
Let's inline this, to match the ORC code

@@ -133,28 +126,43 @@ private IcebergFileWriter createParquetWriter(
             JobConf jobConf,
             ConnectorSession session)
     {
-        Properties properties = new Properties();
-        properties.setProperty(IOConstants.COLUMNS, columns.stream()
-                .map(IcebergColumnHandle::getName)
-                .collect(joining(",")));
-        properties.setProperty(IOConstants.COLUMNS_TYPES, columns.stream()
-                .map(column -> toHiveType(column.getType()).getHiveTypeName().toString())
-                .collect(joining(":")));
-
-        setParquetSchema(jobConf, convert(icebergSchema, "table"));
-        jobConf.set(ParquetOutputFormat.COMPRESSION, getCompressionCodec(session).getParquetCompressionCodec().name());
-
-        return new IcebergRecordFileWriter(
-                outputPath,
-                columns.stream()
-                        .map(IcebergColumnHandle::getName)
-                        .collect(toImmutableList()),

-                properties,
-                HiveStorageFormat.PARQUET.getEstimatedWriterSystemMemoryUsage(),
-                jobConf,
-                typeManager,
-                session);

+                .map(Types.NestedField::name)
+                .collect(toImmutableList());
+        List<Type> fileColumnTypes = icebergSchema.columns().stream()
+                .map(column -> toPrestoType(column.type(), typeManager))
+                .collect(toImmutableList());
+
+        int[] fileInputColumnIndexes = IntStream.range(0, fileColumnNames.size()).toArray();

nodes.bodyText: This entire getMetrics() method is no longer needed. (and should be removed since we're reading the metrics twice for Parquet)
This class is now unused and can be deleted
Let's put this in the util package (we should move more things there)

nodes.bodyText: Changed.  I have to remember to check code that I cut and paste, because the original might not be conformant.
Move this above, after the other integer types
